translated: Birth Stories🔽The Fives
The Chapter about the Ascending Scale of Beauty
The Birth Story of Khajjopana

analyzed: kaḥ nu santamhi pajjote  aggi pariyesanam cara
translated: “Who, when the lamp is burning,🔽would go searching for a fire,
seeing the night lamp,
would think it was a flame?🔽He would blow on the ashes of cow dung,
and on the grass he would blow,
with a distorted perception,
he would not be able to light the lamp.
In this way, without the right means,
the deer will not get the benefit;
from the horns of the cow, the milk,
where he will not find the milk.
By various means,
the young men will get the benefit;
by conquering the enemies,
and by supporting the friends.
By the gain of the commander,
and by the way of the beloved,
the protectors of the world,
live on the earth.”🔽The Birth Story of Khajjopana is the fourth.
